data.Sentence: --- Lesson 48  Did you want to tell me something?

data.Sentence_cn: 牙科医生们总是在你无法作出回答的时候向你提出问题。
data.Sentence: Dentists always ask questions when it is impossible for you to answer.

data.Sentence_cn: 我的牙科医生刚刚给我拔掉了一颗牙，叫我休息一会儿。
data.Sentence: My dentist had just pulled out one of my teeth and had told me to rest for a while.

data.Sentence_cn: 我想说点什么，但我嘴里塞满了药棉。
data.Sentence: I tried to say something, but my mouth was full of cotton wool.

data.Sentence_cn: 他知道我收集火柴盒，于是问我收藏的米柴盒是否在增加。
data.Sentence: He knew I collected match boxes and asked me whether my collection was growing.

data.Sentence_cn: 接着他又问我的兄弟近来如何，问我是否喜欢伦敦的新工作。
data.Sentence: He then asked me how my brother was and whether I liked my new job in London.

data.Sentence_cn: 作为对这些问题的回答，我不是点头，就是发出奇怪的声音。
data.Sentence: In answer to these questions I either nodded or made strange noises.

data.Sentence_cn: 与此同时，我的舌头正在忙着寻找刚拔掉的那颗牙的伤口。
data.Sentence: Meanwhile, my tongue was busy searching out the hole where the tooth had been.

data.Sentence_cn: 我突然非常着急起来，但却什么也说不出来。
data.Sentence: I suddenly felt very worried, but could not say anything.

data.Sentence_cn: 当那位牙医最后将药棉从我嘴中取出时，
data.Sentence: When the dentist at last removed the cotton wool from my mouth,

data.Sentence_cn: 我总算有可能告诉他，他拔错了牙。
data.Sentence: I was able to tell him that he had pulled out the wrong tooth.

title.title: Did you want to tell me something?
